questions.question: I wandered lonely as a _______.
questions.hint: Something that floats in the sky.

questions.question: That floats on high o'er vales and _______.
A _______ of golden Daffodils.
Beside the Lake, beneath the _______.
Fluttering and _______ in the breeze.
Continuous as the _______ that shine.
questions.hint: Heavenly bodies that twinkle at night.

questions.question: And twinkle on the milky _______.
Along the _______ of a bay.
Ten _______ saw I at a glance.
Tossing their heads in _______ dance.
Out-did the sparkling waves in _______.
In such a _______ company.
A Poet could not but be _______.
What _______ the show to me had brought.
For _______ when on my couch I lie.
In _______ or in pensive mood.
They flash upon that _______ eye.
Which is the bliss of _______.
And then my heart with _______ fills.
And dances with the _______.
William Wordsworth was born in the _______ District of England.
'_______' means valleys.
'_______' means thoughtful.
The daffodils stretched in _______-ending line.
The daffodils are described as _______ in colour.
Wordsworth (1770-1850) was one of the greatest _______ poets.
'I wandered lonely as a cloud' is an example of a _______.
The daffodils 'dancing' is an example of _______.
questions.hint: Giving human qualities to non-human things.

questions.question: Wordsworth's treatment of _______ is his chief glory as a poet.
The _______ beside the daffodils also danced.
The poem 'Daffodils' has _______ stanzas.
When inanimate things are given human qualities, we call it _______.
The semicolon (;) is stronger than a _______ but weaker than a full stop.
The colon (:) is used to show that what follows is an _______ or further detail.
'_______ is the mother of invention' is an example of personification.
The poet did not realize what _______ the experience would bring him.
The memory 'flashes' upon the poet's inward _______.
The daffodils were located along the edge of a _______.
questions.hint: A curved part of a lake shore.

questions.question: '_______' and 'wondered' are homophones.
'Heart' and '_______' are homophones.
